questions.question: Daisy says that markets are probably her favourite place to _______________. She says you don’t have to ______________ much money there. But if you’re a tourist, sometimes they can __________________ you high prices.
Read the text. One sentence has been removed from it. Find this sentence.
options: They’re also keen on keeping their mobile technology up to date.
+There are plenty of second-hand websites, too, where stuff’s even cheaper
While they’re there, they also do some online shopping.
You can usually get anything new that way if you’re prepared to wait!

questions.question: Like adults, many teens want good value for money. What does ‘good value for money’ mean in the sentence?
options: where you pay for your goods
+the amount you paid for something was right
a price that is lower than usual
have enough money to buy something

questions.question: They’re also keen on keeping their mobile technology up to date. What does ‘keen on’ mean in the sentence?
options: not new; already used in the past by someone else
where you pay for your goods
+very interested in or enthusiastic about something
a price that is lower than usual

questions.question: Tony isn’t feeling _________________________ today – the boss wants me to work this afternoon.
Maria doesn’t work in this shop __________________.
Find TRUE sentence.
options: His name is Max and he was talking about his shopping experiments
EYEWEAR is a name of his town
+He got a discount because there was a promotion day
He bought new sunglasses two weeks ago

questions.question: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I can't be bought, but I can be stolen with a glance. I'm worthless to one, but priceless to two. What am I?
Why did you decide to buy the trainers yourself instead of waiting for your mum to get them at the end of the month?
options: You found a sale that was about to end.
Your friends convinced you to buy them.
The store was running out of your size.

questions.question: Find the meaning of the words in bold.
options: +someone you can trust and or believe / behaving in a careful way that shows good judgement
enjoying being with people / behaving in a careful way that shows good judgement
someone you can trust and or believe / worried and nervous
behaving in a careful way that shows good judgement / worried and nervous

questions.question: What can you catch but never throw?
What happens when you hug a friend?
options: You copy their gestures, and they smile if you smile.
You check their posts, and you try to remember all the photos and then you ask your friend about them when you see them.
Both are good, in different ways.
+Your body produces oxytocin, which makes you feel good. You feel trust and love.

questions.question: What does ‘pal’ mean in the sentence?
options: movements of your hands, arm or head to show a feeling
remove someone from your social media account

questions.question: What does ‘find out’ mean in the sentence?
options: when you put your arms around someone because you like them
remove someone from your social media account
movements of your hands, arm or head to show a feeling

questions.question: The girls enjoyed _______________ a presentation together for their English class.
David can’t stand ________________ in groups in class, as he always disagrees with the other people.
Pablo is interested in ________________ more articles about friendship in the 21st century.
Find the sentence half: Jackie is keen ____________
options: about playing online games with her friends.
in making music in the school band.
at listening to other people’s problems.
+on going to football matches with friends.

questions.question: Find the sentence half: Jo is afraid _____________
What English word retains the same pronunciation, even after you take away four of its five letters?
options: There isn’t such kind of word

questions.question: What is the name of this graph from IELTS writing task 1?
What is the name of this graph from IELTS writing task 1?
Not yet! I can’t see ________________ places that sell the trainers I want!
Look here. It looks like there are _________________ models listed here in fluorescent green.
Iris likes little shops. She says if you buy something and it’s not right, it’s easy to ______________________ it. You just have to show them the _______________________________.
Correct the mistakes in the sentence: Susan really enjoyed to visit the museum.
options: Susan really enjoyed visit the museum.
Susan really enjoyed to visiting the museum.
Susan really enjoyed to visit the museum.

questions.question: What is the main issue Melissa faces when shopping on Oxford Street?
options: The shops do not sell electronics

questions.question: Find TRUE sentence about Oxford Street.
options: +You can buy clothes, electronics, and books on Oxford Street.
Oxford Street is known for being a quiet and relaxing shopping area.
Oxford Street has more than 500 shops.
Prices on Oxford Street are generally very expensive.

questions.question: Find an example of a process.
